item.title: NBA Wrap: Stojakovic Powers Kings Past Grizzlies
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Peja Stojakovic scored 29 points to steer the Sacramento Kings to their eighth victory in nine games, a 98-93 decision over the Memphis Grizzlies Tuesday.

item.title: Notre Dame Fires Head Coach
item.description: CHICAGO (Reuters) - The University of Notre Dame fired head football coach Tyrone Willingham Tuesday after a 21-15 record over three seasons.

item.title: Browns Head Coach Butch Davis Resigns
item.description: CLEVELAND, Ohio (Sports Network) - Cleveland Browns head coach Butch Davis resigned Tuesday.

item.title: Washington, D.C. Council Moves on Baseball Funding
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Washington, D.C.'s City Council on Tuesday approved a debt and tax-backed financing plan to build a new stadium for Major League Baseball, moving a step closer to bringing baseball back to the U.S. capital.

item.title: College Basketball: Georgia Tech, UConn Win
item.description: ATLANTA (Sports Network) - B.J. Elder poured in a game-high 27 points to lead fourth-ranked Georgia Tech to a convincing 99-68 win over Michigan in the ACC-Big Ten Challenge at Alexander Memorial Coliseum.

item.title: Hingis to Play in Thailand Tournament
item.description: BERN (Reuters) - Former world number one Martina Hingis is planning to make a one-off return to the WTA tour, more than two years after her last professional match.

item.title: Super Bowl Advertisers Still in Game After Scandal
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Advertisers may have been bitten once by an indecency scandal at the 2004 Super Bowl, but they are not shy about getting back into the game for the next U.S. football championship.

item.title: Bucs Release Schroeder and Gramatica
item.description: TAMPA, Fla., (Sports Network) - The Tampa Bay Buccaneers on Tuesday released wide receiver Bill Schroeder and kicker Martin Gramatica, and activated offensive guard Matt O'Dwyer from the physically unable to perform list.

item.title: Hornets' Magloire Sidelined with Finger Injury
item.description: NEW ORLEANS, La. (Sports Network) - New Orleans Hornets center Jamaal Magloire is expected to be sidelined for up to three months because of a dislocated right ring finger.

item.title: Tough Start for Mexico in Final World Cup Qualifiers
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (Reuters) - Mexico will start the final stage of CONCACAF's marathon World Cup qualifying competition with a tough fixture in Costa Rica.
